summary: This bill, the International Traffic in Arms Regulations Licensing Reform Act, aims to expedite the process for licensing the export of defense articles and services. It mandates the Secretary of State to create a list of countries and end-users prioritized for expedited review, along with fixed timelines for application decisions. The bill requires reports to Congress on applications exceeding the set deadlines, detailing justifications for delays. Specifically it sets timelines of 45 days for priority countries and 60 days for other applications.
